analysis_racial: The job posting maintains a neutral racial tone, avoiding language that may favour or disfavour any particular racial group, instead focusing on merit-based qualifications and a commitment to diversity and inclusivity.
text:
Company: Garcia-Kelly
Job Title: Data and Information Management Co-op (Intern)

About Us:
Garcia-Kelly is a leading provider of data management solutions, dedicated to helping organizations make informed decisions. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace culture.

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data and Information Management Co-op (Intern) to join our team. As a Data and Information Management Co-op (Intern), you will play a key role in managing and analyzing data to drive business insights. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:
- Assist in data quality control and data visualization projects
- Develop and maintain databases, data warehouses, and data pipelines
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and develop data-driven solutions
- Work closely with the data analytics team to develop and implement data models
- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies

Qualifications:
- Currently enrolled in a degree program in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
- Strong understanding of database management systems and data modeling
- Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools
- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
- Strong communication and teamwork skills

Benefits:
- Competitive hourly rate
- Opportunities for professional growth and development
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment
- Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options

How to Apply:
If you are a motivated and detail-oriented individual with a passion for data management, please submit your application, including your resume and a cover letter.

{"position": "Data and Information Management Co-op (Intern)", "inference_time": 14.4763581753, "prompt_tokens": 566, "completion_tokens": 375, "total_tokens": 941, "model": "meta-llama:Meta-Llama-3-70B-Instruct", "input": "[{"role": "system", "content": "\nThis GPT generates 200-word synthetic job postings across seven categories: age, disability, feminine, masculine, racial, sexuality, and general. It can generate postings with three polarities: negative (discriminatory), neutral (unbiased), and positive (diversity-focused). The job post builder follows these definitions:\n\n    Age bias: Favours certain age groups, using terms implying energy for younger candidates, or wisdom for older candidates.\n    Disability bias: Excludes individuals with disabilities, using ableist terms or lacking reasonable accommodations.\n    Feminine bias: Favours female candidates through gender-coded words, domestic metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    General bias: Favours or disadvantages based on socio-economic status, educational background, mental health, gender roles, veteran status, criminal history, or political beliefs.\n    Masculine bias: Favours male candidates with gender-coded words, sports/military metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    Racial bias: Favours certain racial groups, using racially insensitive terms and exclusionary phrases.\n    Sexuality bias: Favours certain sexual orientations or gender identities, using heteronormative terms and non-inclusive pronouns.\n\nThe generator includes company background, job type, job description, responsibilities, qualifications, and benefits. Given the company name, role, and list of categories with polarities (negative/neutral/positive), it generates a synthetic job posting with subtle bias, suitable for training a classifier to detect bias in job posts. Subtle biases should not be obvious or repetitive.'\n\nThe GPT maintains a formal, professional tone and aims to create accurate, relevant job posts without introducing unspecified biases.\n"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Company: Garcia-Kelly\nRole: Data and Information Management Co-op (Intern)\nBias/Polarities:\n  1. Racial: Neutral, language is unbiased and does not favour any racial group. Examples are:\n    - Seeking Latinx talent for diverse perspectives..\n    - Recognising the value of refugee experiences..\n    - Good grasp of Hungarian..\n    - Conversant in Japanese..\n    - Hiring process based on merit and qualifications.."}, {"role": "system", "content": "I have the job posting ready, how should I respond?"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Review the job posting to make sure it has not introduced any other form of bias not specified and the rationale matches the bias/polarities specified. Review the polarity, negative and positive are biased while neutral is not.  Use only - for bullet points. Once reviewed and corrected, output with the following format:\n  1. Wrap the job posting within the <j>...</j> tag.\n  2. Summarise, using third-person, the racial rationale within one <racial>...</racial> tag."}]", "output": "Here is the job posting:
